name: W. Ross Ashby
background: British psychiatrist and pioneer of cybernetics. Wrote 'Introduction to Cybernetics' and 'Design for a Brain'. Created the homeostat - early adaptive machine.

principles.name: Law of Requisite Variety
principles.description: A regulator must have as much variety as the disturbances it must counteract. You can't control what you can't match in complexity. Simplistic controls fail against complex problems.
principles.falsification: When you can reduce environmental variety through standardization rather than matching it

principles.name: Self-organization through ultrastability
principles.description: Systems can self-organize to maintain essential variables within limits. Stability emerges from structure, not central control. Design for adaptation, not rigid control.
principles.falsification: In safety-critical systems where emergent behavior is dangerous and explicit control is required

principles.name: Intelligence as adaptation
principles.description: Intelligence is the ability to maintain stability in a changing environment. A system is intelligent to the degree it can adapt to variety it encounters.
principles.falsification: When 'intelligence' requires creativity or goal-setting beyond mere adaptation
